caption: Charming and friendly place indeed! Great service along with good food.
Absolutely the best pasta in the area. So happy to have this place in the neighborhood.

Very nice place, with rather short but very tasty menu. You will have to choose between roughly 10 appetizers and about 8 pastas. But no matter what you choose chances are it will be delicious.  This place would be even better when the weather improves since they have very nice backyard. Definitely would love to come back to try more of their dishes.

This is a really great date spot and the outdoor backyard is fantastic for a date night.   We got two appetizers (tar tare was my favorite and the crudo was great too), two pastas which were fantastic and a tiramisu dessert that was delicious.  The drinks were good, the amaro menu is huge, and the overall ambiance was great.  I will be returning.

Ammazza is my favorite neighborhood spot - always fresh pasta dishes that I think about for days after. Nice ambience for a date night or just a chill dinner with friends. Their backyard space is great, especially when they have live music. They also have an amazing amaro collection! So glad to see this place surviving the pandemic.
Local secret/not so secret anymore Williamsburg hidden gem. This place is a VIBE- the pasta is homemade, the menu is fresh, playlist slaps, service 💯.
Came in expecting at least a decent pasta from all the reviews, but got a vinegar drenched overcooked ravioli. Thank you.
food was horrible. This place is gross. Don’t understand why it has such good reviews. This restaurant belongs in an airport. Don’t go here
No concept of flavor. My stomach kind of hurts. Save your money and go elsewhere
Do not come here. All the food was disgusting. Absolutely disgusting. Do not come here.
Order from here only if you want to starve. I placed an order, it took them over 2 hours to get a driver.
Pastas are amazing and cocktail so nice too! Love this spot

Hands down the best food in all of New York City! All of the dishes are pure perfection. The chef is a magician, drinks are on point and the service is super nice. The overall hospitality is simply outstanding. Such a perfect place for date nights, family gatherings, meetings, anything. I’m in love with this place! It’s definitely a must try. Trust me, you will be in heaven.

Came here with my friend and we had such a great experience! The service was on point - everyone was very friendly and attentive. We had the burrata, quadrotti, and agnolotti - all amazing! Can’t wait to try other dishes on the menu and will definitely come back often!
Food and service are incredible, love this cozy neighborhood spot
Amazing food, service, and lovely safe atmosphere outdoors. The heat lamps are perfect, the pasta is fresh, and the wine pours are generous
Cozy heated patio with a beautiful patio space!
What a great restaurant,wonderful atmosphere, excellent food, and don't miss the spectacular sunset 🌇 This is a must go!!!!
Great neighborhood staff. Awesome chef owner. Beautiful spacious backyard
Dining here was a memorable experience. The staff were welcoming, the ambience was romantic, and the food was delicious. Great options for vegetarians as well. I will definitely recommend.
Tasty. Recommend the green salad, chicken 'parmageddon', sea trout tartare

I placed an order on New Year's Eve through Postmates because I live in Astoria and we really wanted to try this restaurant. After an hour and 15 minutes of waiting for our food after the restaurant confirmed, Postmates cancelled the order because they didn't have a driver to deliver. I called the restaurant and the owner offered to drive it to me herself at 9:30pm and told me she would remake the food since it had been sitting there for a half hour waiting to be picked up. During such difficult times for all small businesses and restaurants, I am blown away by the service here. Thank you so much!

For starters, the pasta was well made and the taste was great, but for 70 dollars leaving hungry is not an Italian dinner for me. For two people to get an appetizer and two pasta dinners and leave hungry it’s simply not an Italian restaurant. But again, it was delicious and well made, just not worth the cost.
We were able to make reservations for 4, we sat outside. Nice atmosphere. I had the Bolognese,  pasta was cooked perfectly al dente ,  the best sauce !

Delicious and easy! Exactly what you want in a neighborhood restaurant; I'll be coming back many times.  Highlights include: - Easy to get a reservation - The pork belly, agnolotti, and doppio were very, very good  Lowlight: - Tiramisu was not good tiramisu. As food it was tasty - but it was a poorly executed Tiramisu.
This is a whatever place, just overpriced for nothing special ! There are so much better options go somewhere else!
Great staff and ambience. Incredible food, the skewers are amazing. Pastas too, great date spot.
Tasty pasta, nice backyard
The best
The food and service were ahead of my expectations. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. Wonderful place to take the family out for lunch.

Everything started good, but then went downhill in a hurry. The portions: tiny. The food: ok but not for the price. Service: polite. We were a party of four who had spent $250. After our meal they informed us that we had exceeded their 90 minute time limit and had to leave. I can't remember another time that I have been so insulted at a restaurant. I promptly informed the manager and owner, to which the response they gave me was nothing more than a shrug of the shoulders. This is Brooklyn yuppie obnoxiousness at its finest. As a life long New Yorker, your restaurant is an insult to my city.

Came here for my birthday and it was a perfect meal, excellent service, great ambiance and all around great experience. Sat in their back garden area and all was just excellent. The duck entree was an absolute delight, although really everything was delicious.
Wonderful food and good service. Love the cocktails. A bit pricey but you get what you pay for!! Will be back.

The owner was very nice and always coming around to see if you needed something. Although, I must say that food and drinks are exceptional and left the restaurant very happy. I highly recommend this place!! ☺️😋

Every dish is just spot on, tried them all and each one is well thought out. Fantastic food, great interesting cocktails and a phenomenal Amaro selection. Backyard seating is open and it's very cute back there. Bonus points for live music on Sundays. Pasta all made in house. Best Trattoria in north Brooklyn hands down.

This has become one of our local spots in Williamsburg for amazing food. A thoughtfully considered menu. It's not your average pasta joint. The average pasta place will clog your arteries with their overly creamy, disproportionate servings. Quality fresh ingredients and decent portions will win over even the most basic diners.  We've eaten in, ordered delivery and also tried their to-go mealkits during COVID. The quality of food is never compromised and that's why we'll keep supporting them, for consistently delivering great food.

This place is amazing. The first time I went the power in the whole block was out and the chefs were working with flashlights pinned between their shoulders and ears. They still managed to prepare some of the best pasta I’ve had in Brooklyn.  Now with covid-19 they’ve pivoted to sandwiches. We tried 3 and every one of th was fantastic. So well balanced, great bread, really amazing.  One of the best restaurants in Brooklyn

This place was awesome. It’s one of those amazing finds that just does pretty much everything right. My wife is slightly obsessed w pasta and their lobster pasta special was perfectly cooked. I also loved the beef tar tar and thought the pork belly was really well done, it felt Italian but cooked w some Japanese influence, really good.  We came w a bunch of kids and my daughters a rather picky eater. Even then she polished off all of her pasta and went on to eat her siblings.  The staff was very accommodating to our family. If I lived in this neighborhood I’d come here all the time. The only fault I can think of is that it’s not near my home.
The portions are small but filling. The staff was great eventhough our waitress had a large party she was very attentive to us.
Awesome place

Came in without a reservation but we got sited, we order on a family style to enjoy the different plates. None of the plates we ordered are something that we would order again but the services was great and the drinks were good.
Nice place.

So delicious. We had the pork shoulder ragu and the duck. Both were incredible. We also had some nice cocktails and tiramisu. The atmosphere is trendy without feeling cold. The staff was extremely nice and attentive. Can't wait to go back.
Fave spot for a glass of wine and appetizers at the bar. Friendly staff and great wine selection.
Don't want to remember.😠👎👎👎
(Translated by Google) An excellent and pleasant place to share with friends and family  (Original) Un ecelente y agradable lugar para compartir con amigos y familia
two vegetarian options there for pastas and both are absolutely delicious! I just wish the portions were bigger because it is soooooooooo tasty! Nice atmosphere and staff as well.
Amazing food, friendly and knowledge staff and coozy yet trendy atmosphere. The in house made pasta is out of this world and the sunchoke appetizer is an experience.
Really good, creative, and tasty food. Service is OK.
Nice
Great food and service.
Excellent brunch! Excelente prices! I’m happy and full 😂

First things first - the staff here is LOVELY. The only reason it even gets two stars is because of how amazing they are. But the food was under seasoned across the board. And half the food was mushy and overcooked, while the other half was undercooked. While it's a beautiful space, there are some issues there too. Overcrowding led to a 30 minute wait even though we had a reservation and a lack of control over the radiators led to a table switch mid meal. Again - the staff handled all these issues with grace, but unfortunately we won't be returning.
so great food nice atmosphere delightful service!
This spot always delivers. They have fresh dishes for fair rates, there is no waiting time even when they are full.
Great food

I went to this place for the first time over the weekend and I'm afraid I was dissapointed.  After so many good reviews I was looking forward to going but while the service was good I felt that this restaurant was extremely over priced for what we got.  First we were given stale bread at our table and the olive oil for dipping was of poor quality and funky tasting.  I don't recall ever going to an Italian restaurant and being served bad bread and olive oil.  This is something that never happens.  The second thing was that my sister in law and I ordered the shrimp appetizer which we thought we would share only to be served ONE prawn on a plate for around $6 and this wasn't a large prawn.  Once you removed the head it was an average sized shirmp at best.  To add to this insult it was slightly over cooked and had a stong shrimpy flavor like it was less than fresh.   The  pasta was good but nothing amazing and the panna cotta dessert was the only thing that saved the meal for me, otherwise I would have given this restaurant one star.   For two people this meal was well over $100 and I don't feel that it was worth the cost.  We won't be back.
Everything about this place is great. The handmade pastas are delicious, love the cocktails and wine selection. The live Jazz on Sundays is really nice. It’s an all rounder 🙌🏻
(Translated by Google) The restaurant is romantic and warm, and the food tastes great.  (Original) 餐馆布置浪漫温馨，食物味道很棒。

Appetizers were amazing (thus the 3 stars). Entree and dessert was subpar compared to it's high price point. I had much better bolognese for $10 and theirs were $19 just to give a comparison. Also the portions were extremely small.
Feels like a hidden gem. Delicious pasta. Honest and friendly service. Beautiful outdoor area. Recommend!!

I don't usually write reviews but I had to write about this place in particular. When I stepped into the restaurant with my family it looked clean and actually very nice and accomadting so I had high expectations, mind you I live about 30min away from here so I was expecting alot based on the reviews. I honestly have no idea on why this place would have 5 stars I was shocked that it did. When our server came to seat us she looked kind of tipsy which I didnt pay mind to at the moment. The menus were just regular paper menus and very few options to choose from. Our server returned and explained some things on the menu which I asked her to do so, yet she never advised that the appetizers were served cold and once we ordered the main dishes which my brother ordered pork she never asked if he wanted the meat well done or medium nothing. The server, kitchen staff and bartenders were all drinking wine at plain sight of the customers. The food was not good to tell u the least me my mother and I left with stomach aches, the drinks are overpriced as well as the food. Honestly the restaurant just looks nice because in regards to food and drinks its just bad. Service isnt bad when your being served by tipsy staff members I mean really? If your going to drink don't do it so bluntly in front of the customers. I will never be returning to this place and I honestly just wanted to leave this review to advise customers to not waste their time and money because u will be disappointed. Portions are so small from food to drinks and so overpriced it's ridiculous you would have to be desperate for food to stop here to say the least, what a disappointment!

One of the best pastas I’ve had!!!  Went here on a date and we had a really fun night dining at this location. The hostess was very friendly and welcomed us as soon as we arrived. We were seated at the bar as our table was not ready (we got there 15 mins earlier than our reservation) which gave us a chance to go through their extensive amaro collection and cocktail list. We ended up ordering the “A place beyond the Alpine” and “Orange Ferrari” (both were very good) by which time our table was ready. For appetizer we ordered the Calamari (delicious!!) and for the main course we got Agnolotti ( Seriously by far the best pasta I’ve had and which I’ll be dreaming about for days to come) and Gemelli Verde (fantastic!). And finally for desert we got the strawberry Panna cotta.  The service was good, the food arrived fast and everything was just excellent. This place is a real gem. Also I believe they have Jazz performances on Sundays (which sadly we didn’t know about when we made our reservation on a Saturday). We will definitely come
Great food, great vibe, nice outdoor seating.

Can’t recommend enough. Incredible food, great service, perfect intimate vibe during every season. Every single pasta is perfectly cooked and prepared. They’re all unique and give a different experience. My favorite is the rigatoni. My suggestion for the restaurant is to do something about the bugs in the back. Love the patio, hate getting bitten so much during a nice meal.

Had dinner with a group of friends. Service was good. We had the tartare to share, and the pork shoulder red sauce pasta (Reginette) and the Agnolotti, both were incredible. Prices were slightly higher but not outrageous for the food quality.
Mucha grass to much  Cholesterol

If only I could give 0 stars. We were there since 6pm to meet friends and had a dinner reservation for 8pm. We didn’t get our food til 10pm. Rude service. Food took 2 hours to start arriving and didn’t even all come in the end. We had to keep reminding them to bring our drinks and food over. Finally asked to speak to the manager and the waiter’s response was “she’s busy”. Manager couldn’t even come over to help and make amends. We spent almost 700$ on food and drinks and this is the worst service I’ve ever encountered in my life in NY. When we left the manager was just sitting at bar doing nothing. DO NOT RECOMMEND
Food is highly recommended, especially all the housemade, fresh pastas! I can tell that Chef created each menu dish with deep consideration. Solid wine list with great cocktails as well.
Delicious, nice cocktails 🍸 and of course Amaro

(Translated by Google) Very tasty, really great taste. The pasta is awesome! 🤩👍 unfortunately, the portions are too small and the price too high. Nice & cozy atmosphere. Tip: It's best to go as a group & try & share everything;)  (Original) Ultra lecker, wirklich toller Geschmack. Die Pasta ist der Hammer! 🤩👍 leider sind die Portionen zu klein und der Preis zu hoch. Schönes & gemütliches Ambiente. Tipp: Am besten als Gruppe hingehen & von allem probieren & teilen ;)
Happy hour is great! Bartender is super nice and makes great drinks!  Didn't try the food yet

Staff is super friendly and attentive. Food was very fresh and flavorful. Started with both pork belly and squid spiedini, which were both excellent. Moved to the Buffalo mozzarella, which was fresh and creamy.  Tried their special of the night, Udine, for an entree - Jumbo lump crab with spicy tomato base and homemade ribbon pasta. Everything was phenomenal from the drinks to the conversation. Will be back soon!!
Good menu and service
Pasta was pretty good! It's a cute space. The food kind of reminds me of stuff I could make by myself at home though.

Very tasty food and surprising flavors. Super chill atmosphere and excellent place for friends gathering. Service could be a bit more efficient from a timing point of view but it’s performed with such grace and smiles that it doesn’t really matter. I’ll be back.

Ammazzacaffè opened early for us so we didn't need to stress out about Then She Fell. They had a lovely selection of food options- the panchetta and various pastas in particular were fantastic. Service was attentive and it was a good way to start an evening. We definitely recommend Ammazzacaffè. :)
Very good!!
Friendly staff, wonderful food!

Great location with wonderful ambiance and AMAZING food!!!  Kelly, the co-owner and co-workers are so helpful, informative and so very nice!  We were so happy to be at this great restaurant with amazing food!  Don’t miss the squash dish...yummy!
Good food nice place.  They suggest you share but the portions are not family style size so not easy especially with bigger groups.
(Translated by Google) I know  (Original) Se
Wonderful collection of Italian dishes! Best pork starter we ever had! Excellent service and adorable owners, making the venue feel welcoming and like home. We will be back. Multiple times :)
Great staff. Phenomenal homemade pastas.  Would love them to expand the menu with a few more protein-focused dishes.
Great food , Great atmosphere.

Food is amazing. It will not disappoint. The Cocktails are spot on and they indeed have an extensive and amazing supply of Amaro (amari). That being said, the servers are clueless. For the price of this restaurant I expected knowledgeable/professional servers. The only person to seem to know hospitality was the bartender. Anyway, do not tip 18%-20%. They look like they came to work to collect their tips and clock out.

Very classy looking place with a warm and welcoming staff. The pasta dishes are good but a smaller in portion size than what we’re used to. The menu is also a limited when compared to other Italian restaurants in the area and does not describe the dishes in full detail. The wine menu was too limited for our personal tastes. While the dishes were OK, they were just “OK” and a bit disappointing considering what great Italian restaurants exists in Williamsburg.

Pretty Brooklyn backyard with big tables and nice ambiance is a great place to sample wonderful, unique fresh pasta creations.  I had a spaghetti with a tart moroccan lemon tang, a traditional pork ragu, and a nutty agnoletti.  All were wonderful.  I will try the Primi next time.  My friend's cocktail was tasty but not super creative.  I had a tequila cocktail that was like an orange marg., and much more complex.  Our servers and the hostess were lovely and extremely helpful and sweet.

One of the best pastas I’ve ever had. The tartar was excellent as well. Would love to come back so I can try more things.  Lilia is still the better place in Brooklyn I think but this is worth going to. Very good and friendly staff.
Beautiful space with friendly staff. I sat at th bar and had the pancetta, which was delicious. On Sunday nights they have live music.
Delicious but $18-20 for pasta dish, not family style
Delicious pasta! Good belgian beer.

Amazing food and wine, the chef and sommelier are extremely knowledgeable and friendly. The garganelli has an excellent texture, clearly made fresh from scratch, and the sauce is exactly right. The agnolotti (also fresh pasta from scratch) is equally delicious, good balance of pasta and richness in the sauce.  The sommelier made excellent recommendations, both with our starters (frissante rose) as well as the mains (dolcetto). Complemented the food very well, and extremely reasonable for the quality. Definitely ask for advice here, she'll steer you right.
Very cozy atmosphere in their outdoor courtyard. Excellent food!
Absolutely amazing place.  Great food, great wine and great staff.  A must visit when you are in the area.

This is a very quaint and comforting place. The food is magnificant and beyond delicious. I would completely recommend it to anyone who asks. The server is very knowledgeable of the menu and very patient to answer all our questions. We'll worth it. A must go to Italian Restaurant. Compliments to the chef
One of the most amazing culinary experiences of my life. It was all a amazing. The restaurant is appropriately named!

TL;DR : this place is amazing and you should try it before it becomes too popular to get a seat. I had to remove some stuff here because of Google's character limits.  Let me preface this by saying I did not want to write this review. I think Yelp is generally misused by people who either want to have their server fired for a perceived slight or hope to get a free dessert. I, selfishly, hoped that I could keep Trattoria Ammazzacaffe a secret to be enjoyed by myself and as few other people as possible. That would, however, not be fair to Gary and Kelly, the duo behind this treasure, who poured their souls into creating an amazing experience or their staff who execute their vision.  I visited the restaurant for a date once before but I wanted to return and experience it again on my own. I highly recommend everyone does the same. When you walk in you are greeted and asked for your preference in seating. If you, like me, wish to enjoy your respite from the outside world you’re best served to take your seat at the bar. I wrote a paragraph about how beautiful the bar and woodwork is but deleted it. Just go see it and touch it for yourself.  If you have an eye for this sort of thing you’ll quickly notice the meticulous details that characterize Ammazzacaffe. The dining areas are connected by a service station that equal parts transparent and intimate. You will not believe the quality of food and drink that comes out of such a compact space. The backyard is perfect for Summer in Brooklyn. Oh, and the music is on point for good measure.  I strolled into the restaurant at around 8:30pm and took my seat on the corner of the bar. Kelly had mentioned before that I should come back and try the duck, she warned me that it can take over an hour but was well worth it, so I came prepared for and enjoyed a long evening.  I started off with a Negroni as I’d never had one before and felt this particular bar would be a good place to try one. I was correct.  Before the first course you receive olives in an house herb oil. If you, like me, have had an aversion to olives, these olives will change your mind. If they sold their herb oil in bulk you'd probably find me trying to bathe in it, it's that good.  My first course was the pancetta. Now I’ve had a lot of a pork in my day. But this was something different. If you want to know how to perfectly balance meat, fat, and crunch in your pork, ask Gary. The cherry pepper and agro-dolce bring this together for a pop of umami many chefs dream mastering of without ever achieving.  Second was the Gémelli Verde. Kelly paired this perfectly with a mineral-y white wine (name escapes me) that was a real treat  A bite that includes the pasta, maitake mushrooms, goat cheese, and spinach will make you question how something this simple can taste as good as it does; until you realize that’s exactly why.  For my main course, what I’d made this particular journey for, I had the aged duck. You should, too. Before this evening I had only had one moment, tasting a 1994 Chateau Haut-Brion, in which the taste made me truly feel something. The ephemeral moment of skin and meat on the tongue is, in my opinion, perfect. I do not have the words to properly describe it. You may wish to close your eyes and really focus on it. I did, at least. Paired with a Syrah forward Cotes du Rhone that sang particularly well. After a few bites I felt compelled to tell Chef Gary that it was the best I've ever had. Because it is.  For dessert you should have the ricotta. If they have any left. Trust me. Just do it, okay?  I finished my evening with a single espresso and an amaro of Kelly's choosing. I could have died absolutely content with life right then and there.  Bring a date here, bring your parents here, bring your kids here. I don't care, this place will knock their socks off.  Or, better yet, don’t bring anyone, just yourself. Sit at the bar, turn off your phone, and pay attention. But, move quickly, before everyone else finds out.
My favorite neighborhood Italian spot. Awesome homemade pasta, large aperitif menus and super friendly staff!
Loved this place! The pork belly & calamari bites were incredible! Had the Fusilli pasta which was yum. Cool place, great food, well priced 👌🏿
Very nice restaurant. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. A must try for the duck and calamari. Amaro a must.

Clearly the 1 star reviews have never had authentic Italian food--to that I say, enjoy Olive Garden--- This restaurant changed the meaning of Italian Food. Every time I go there, I keep saying food cannot get any tastier. And then again, the chef goes above and beyond to invent new and exciting menu items with new tastes and layers of flavor----really takes the dishes to new and exciting heights.
Food is delicious, jazz on Sunday nights, service was mehhhh but I'll definitely go back. Good for a date or to bring a group. Posh but not too posh.

Absolutely OVERRATED. The design is below average, very low sits, food tastes awful, hugely overpriced, the menu is small and quite pretentious, you can barely know what you’re ordering, not Italian in a bit. Don’t waste your time and $$.

Ammazzacaffe is by far the best restaurant in East Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly and the service is outstanding. They have an amaro pro behind the bar, a Sommelier on duty and a genius in the kitchen. The owners remodeled the place from top to bottom and didn’t leave a single detail overlooked. From the the elegant crystals at the bar to the custom woodwork throughout, the space is an aesthetic gem. I’ve been coming here since the week they opened. I’ve tried every dish on the menu and they’re all incredible. The prices are low and the portions are big enough to share. Keep up the great work guys!

At first I gave this review 2 stars instead of 1 because the service was good, but after someone of the management staff found my review funny I will downgrade it to 1 since you guys are  being disrespectful. here’s the story of my experience there. To start with... I am truly shocked that this place has 5 stars reviews. They have accommodating and friendly staff but that’s about it. My biggest disappointment was the food. To say that it was mediocre would be an understatement. I was thoroughly searching for the best place for my bday party and picked this one because of the good reviews. Well, it turned out to be a huge mistake. Portions size is ridiculously small, appetizer with 1 piece of burned prawn for $7? Like really?! Calamari app had black garlic on it which tasted odd, pancetta app (pork belly) was drown in a fatty and spicy sauce with some weird stuff on the top that tasted awfully bad. You may wonder how someone can ruin a piece of lettuce. Well, this place surely knows how to do it, again, it was drown in the sauce that was way too sour, like a mixture of expired Caesar and ranch dressings. But the number one reward in the category Suckiest Dish goes to Cacciucco Bianco which is a weird combination of a very few pieces of seafood, spicy Japanese dressing and a bunch of soggy bread floating in the broth. Charging $38 for it is a real theft. On top of that, my friend had a teeny tiny margarita for $13 which was pretty basic. And let me add that it took very looong time for the food to be delivered although the restaurant was empty. To sum up, I cannot describe how disappointed I am, picking this place for my bday celebration. I was really ashamed that I brought my friends to a restaurant with horrible food, poor portions and preposterously high prices. I hope you guys reevaluate the menu and, instead of desperate attempts to be fancy and top notch, choose simpler options with some edible dishes, not an odd mixture of incompatible ingredients that taste like a waste of money. Needless to say we left hungry and hit a spot one block away with some decent food and moderate prices.

Service, product, and ambiance... All on point. You should go here. Or actually don't- I'd have to start waiting for a table. So now that I think about it actually... tell no one about how amazingly awesome this place is. Our little secret!

At first glance it doesn’t look like much from the outside, but once you come inside it is quite presentable and looks nice. The staff is super polite, very accommodating and professional . We didn’t have to wait to be seated, our reservation was honored in a timely fashion. However, the tables are so close together you are on a date with everyone. The music is kind of loud, and for a hipster place I was surprised for rap to be the choice. The menu is unreadable(few English words), tiny(from salads to main corse, probably about 16 items in total) out of which some were unavailable at the time. Drink service was impeccable. The food on the other hand took forever to come, and in between dishes also seamed like a lifetime. The food was bland, the portions small, not thought out. For example, three little pieces of pork belly or calamari were about $6 each. The pasta with some ground beef in it is about  $18, and had large pieces of rosemary I had to pick out because it was hard and inedible. In conclusion the place as is the staff, but some things including the food could use some improvement.
The food and service are absolutely amazing! Came for a bday dinner and couldn’t be happier with the choice. Ammazzacaffe is one for the books.

I like it here. Small menu, pasta and excellent prices. This isn't fancy and this isn't the finest dinning in Brooklyn.  This is a consistent, clean, comfortable, tasty, and affordable restaurant that has exceptional service.

The service here is amazing. The atmosphere is also super relaxed and fun. The food however is mediocre since it is a bit over salted and overpriced. I ordered calimari and it is not the typical breaded calimari with a ton of pieces. They serve 2 pieces of squid on a stick with a special seasoning. It tasted great but in my opinion was a bit expensive.
(Translated by Google) The atmosphere is very good, the taste of the dishes is more distinctive, and it is suitable for a place to drink at night.  (Original) 氣氛很好，菜色味道比較有特色，適合晚上小酌的地點。
Great food & service, excellent experience

Just happened to pass by this place and popped in to have a quick dinner. Turned out to be a really good choice; the pasta was super good and there was a good selection of wines to go with it as well. Very much recommended!

Excellent food! Different from Il Passatore, another great Italian restaurant down the street, but amazing all the same. I had the burgundy snails and tuna tartare. I couldn't recommend those dishes enough. Excited to come back here and try the other dishes.
Amazing food and great beverage program. Lovelovelove this place. If you are looking for house made fresh pastas, and unique food with good wine, this is the place to go!

Ammazzacaffe is the most quality driven dining experience you can have in the 'East Williamsburg' area of Brooklyn.  It is arguably the best value of any high quality Italian restaurant in the 5 boroughs.  The pasta is always on point - al dente as it should be, and made fresh, in house, everyday. The starters are f@&$ing gems...the sea bass tartare and sunchoke antipasti should be tattooed on my belly...  I could continue with more "Run. Don't walk..." or you could just come and check it for yourself. Best Wishes to these guys.
Amazing food and wines... causal and extremely charming. A hidden gem in Brooklyn, on the cusp of stardom.

Amazing Food, Drink, Service, Ambiance & Decor, Value--all smiles, no pretension or attitude.  At 8:30 on a Saturday the place was full but not packed (hint hint: no wait for the best food in the area!).  Been here twice. We shared all three of the spiedini (prawn, pork belly, calamari). Soooooo yummy, very complex but balanced flavors including that delicious just-grilled crisp. Then the bolognese (delicious!) and snail pastas--give it a try! ALL PASTAS MADE IN HOUSE, all ingredients fresh and top quality.  THE HOUSE-CURED GREEN OLIVES WERE AMAZING  (warm!). I had the Rose Gold cocktail--just a tad sour balanced by floral and herby and hint of bitter. LOVED the first white wine on the list by the glass: full but not sweet and no acid.  Loved it with the amazing SEA TROUT TARTAR, topped with roe and came with crunchy bread. I had the ***vegetarian green pasta*** soooooooo goood. Again, complex, balanced, fresh everything. My date LOVED the special pasta, a black one with seafood puttenesca. Based on how good it was, next time will definitely have to try the black risotto with seafood and the other seafood pasta on their regular menu.  DIETARY RESTRICTIONS VERY EASILY ACCOMMODATED. Many things can be served Gluten- and Dairy- Free.  We were the last customers of the night and were having such a great time we didn't even know it! WE WERE NOT RUSHED OR KICKED OUT! They even laughed with us when we realized it! :)

Everything is amazing. Except the music. The food has so. Much. Personality. And you're playing f-ing elevator music!  I would come here all the time if you played songs with personality - I'm not picky, Roy Orbison or Miles Davis or Fleetwood Mac or Sam Cooke or any thing that doesn't sound like garbage bland yuppie pseudo-electronics.  You have the best food in the hood and I don't want to come back because of the terrible music. Hope someone reads this, and four weeks from now I give you another shot and become a regular.

Went here for dinner on a Saturday night, not crowded and I have no idea why. This is without a doubt the best pasta I have ever tasted in my entire life. We got the Tartare and Barbabetole to start and both were exquisite, but the highlight of the night were the Torcia, Mafaldine, and Rigatone. It makes my mouth water just thinking about them. Perfectly cooked noodles and some of the richest and most wonderful flavors. I can't recommend more highly. If  you're in Willamsburg for one night only this is the place to go.
(Translated by Google) Excellent spot for modern Italia inspired cousin  (Original) Excellente spot for modern Italia inspired cousine
Love this new addition to the neighborhood.  Fantastic atmosphere.  Fantastic service.  Stellar wine list.  The food is beautiful - innovative, but also deliciously traditional.  fantastic.

Fantastic and authentic pasta, with an excellent Amaro selection. This is real modern Italian, not the cheesy stuff you find in little Italy. This is there perfect hidden gem restaurant for date night. Oh and the name? It means coffee killer. It's the drink you have after your evening Espresso: Amaro.

This new addition to the neighborhood just raised the bar HIGH. The food (o mio dio!), drinks and equally important the decor. TOP TOP TOP! Brunch, Aperitivo, Dinner... you name it. Make sure to end your meal with a Cafe Corretto.

Ammazza caffe is a great addition to the neighborhood. We had a delicious meal and really enjoyed the attentive service. You can tell the team really cares, lots of attention to detail. Also, the wine and amaro selection is tops! love this spot
The tartare and nerone were out of this world! Amazing food and great service.

The service here is great and the food even better. We ordered Nerone, Rigatoni, and Mafaldine. Nerone has a kick to it and it was good but def overpriced. I recommend the pasta dishes. My favorite was the Rigatoni. Mafaldine has goat cheese in it which can overpower the other flavors so if you love goat cheese this one is for you. All the pastas are housemade! We also ordered calamari skewers as apps but I say skip it and save room for pasta. Highly recommended. Go before it gets busy =)
food always above and beyond, a notch above the other neighborhood joints, excellent wine/cocktail selection, aces!
Amazing atmosphere and great food! Great selection of wine and amaro.
